title: 115_hr3077
content: The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals certain subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to section 203, including changes to subsections (c), (d), and (e). Additional amendments are made to section 202(n)(1) regarding benefits terminated upon deportation. Section 202(n)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended to remove references to sections 203(b), (c), and (d) and insert a reference to section 203(b). Section 202(q) is also amended to update provisions related to exemptions from reductions based on early retirement. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 amended provisions related to exemptions from reductions in Social Security benefits based on certain entitlements. Section 202(s) of the Social Security Act was modified to update references to section 203(b) and remove outdated references. The Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017 amended provisions related to exemptions from reductions in Social Security benefits. It updated references to section 203(b) and removed outdated references in the Social Security Act. Amendments were made to various sections, including 202(t)(7), 203(a)(3)(B)(iii), and 208(a)(1)(C). Amendments were made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including section 208(a)(1)(C) regarding penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings for deductions from benefits on account of work. Amendments to the Social Security Act include provisions on benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and defining income for SSI purposes. Amendments to the Social Security Act include defining wages for SSI purposes as wages defined in section 209, without certain limitations on remuneration amounts. Services performed by an individual as an employee within or outside the United States are considered in this definition. Services performed by an individual as an employee within or outside the United States shall be deemed employment if the remuneration is not included in the individual's net earnings for SSI purposes. Wages do not include certain payments made for retirement or upon termination of employment. The curr_chunk discusses payments made by an employer to an employee or their dependents upon retirement. It also mentions the repeal of deductions under the Railroad Retirement Program. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to the Railroad Retirement Program, including the redesignation of subsections and conforming amendments. The effective date of these changes is also mentioned. The amendments made to the Railroad Retirement Program, including redesignation of subsections, will apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2018.
